meanings.definition: A knot or loop in a rope or cord.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tied the tyes to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The tyes in the shoelaces kept coming undone.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the tyes to create a tiny swing.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a tangled mess of tyes, impossible to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The tyes in the net were so tight, nothing could slip through.

meanings.definition: A band or cord used to fasten or secure something.
meanings.sent1: The tyes on the gift box were beautifully decorated.
meanings.sent2: She used colorful tyes to bundle the flowers together.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of tyes from his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The tyes of friendship bound them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The tyes of tradition held the community close.

meanings.definition: A strip of material used for binding or wrapping.
meanings.sent1: She tore a piece of fabric to make tyes for the gift.
meanings.sent2: The tyes of the bandage kept the wound clean.
meanings.sent3: The chef used tyes of bacon to wrap the asparagus.
meanings.sent4: The tyes of ivy wrapped around the old tree like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The tyes of the ribbon fluttered in the breeze.
